text:
My web application - based on servlets/jsp - uses log4j for server logging.
We correctly instantiate the logger and configurator in our first servlet.
Sometimes, when i start up tomcat, it says that tomcat is IGNORING 
configuration file (l4j.conf).
we tried copying this file under $tomcat/bin and under webapps/root_directory 
too, and the file is readable by everyone, but the error still remains.
we can't reproduce this error everytime we restart the servlet-engine, but we 
just want to know what this is due to.

The same web application (same servlets, same tomcat release, same log4j 
release, same log4j configuration file) under Windows2000 works correctly.
creator: marco.frattola@zucchetti.it

text:
Which version of Tomcat is this? Can you be more specific about the
errors you get? What is this IGNORING message?

Thanks, Ceki
creator: ceki@apache.org

text:
OS: SunOS 5.8
apache release: 1.3.9
tomcat release: 3.2.1
log4j release: 1.0.4

the exact error message is: 
"log4j:ERROR Could not read configuration file [l4j.conf]."
but the file l4j.conf is present in the tomcat's bin subdirectory and readable 
by everyone

then, when the main servlet tries to initialize the log4j system, it puts out 
this message:
"log4j:ERROR Ignoring configuration file [l4j.conf]."
creator: marco.frattola@zucchetti.it

text:
This error is thrown because log4j cannot find the file. You should also see
an exception explaining the cause of the problem.
creator: ceki@apache.org
